article:
{{Interventions infobox | Name = | Image = | Caption = | ICD10 = | ICD9 = |
MeshID = | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | HCPCSlevel2 = }} 'Transurethral biopsy' is
a biopsy procedure in which a sample of tissue is removed from the prostate for
examination under a microscope. A thin, lighted tube is inserted through the
urethra into the prostate, and a small piece of tissue is removed with a
cutting loop.
